did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection contains a letter written from H. G. Davis to his son written June 19, 1876, and discusses land for sale.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from H. G. Davis Letter must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: H. G. Davis Letter, Ms2012-064, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was purchased as part of lot of family letters by Special Collections in September 2012. The letter did not appear to have a connection to the other two families, so it was removed and processed as a separate collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the H. G. Davis Letter was completed in October 2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Unfortunately with only initials and a common last name to whom to attribute the letter, it is difficult to determine which H. G. Davis wrote the letter, rendering the author a mystery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a letter written from H. G. Davis to his son written June 19th, 1876. The letter apologizes for Davis's inability to visit due to incessant rain. Davis also encourages his son to look into buying a farm, promising him preferential treatment from the seller and offering him advice as to how he could afford it.
